landing.title: Introduction
landing.textContent:
This work takes the form of a questionnaire that uses color as a means of communication.
Your individual responses, when compiled at the end of the exhibition, will collectively create a kind of picture of society.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.textContent:
For each question, in addition to your answer, you will have the option to leave a comment by clicking on the "comment" button at the bottom of the page. All answers and comments received will be published anonymously.

At the end of each question, click "continue" to move on to the next question. You can skip a question at any time and move on to the next one.

0.title: 0. Vivid Color
0.topContent: To answer the questions, you will need to create a colour by moving the sliders (the small black circles) on the vertical axes representing the primary colours cyan, magenta, and yellow. To practice, drag the sliders below up to create a vivid color (red, orange, blue, purple, green, etc.) that combines two primary colors. Then click continue.

1.title: 1. Skin Color
1.topContent: Pour créer des couleurs plus naturelles (corail, sable, pêche, olive, etc.), il est généralement nécessaire de combiner les trois couleurs primaires. En utilisant au moins une touche de chaque couleur primaire, tentez de reproduire la couleur de votre teinte de peau naturelle, sans bronzage.

2.title: 2. Pleasant Color
2.topContent: Now, create a color of your choice, which you think is pleasant.

3.title: 3. Mood of the Day
3.topContent: How are you feeling today? Try to create a colour that expresses your mood for the day so far.

4.title: 4. Your Life
4.topContent: How has your life been so far? Try to create a colour that expresses how you feel about your life as a whole.

5.title: 5. Your Future
5.topContent: How do you imagine your future? Try to create a colour that matches what you see.

6.title: 6. Your City
6.topContent: Think about the physical environment of the entire city, town or territory where you currently live. Try to create a colour that best represents what comes to mind.

7.title: 7. Your City, 2050
7.topContent: Now imagine your city, municipality or territory in 2050. What future do you see? Try to create a colour that best represents what comes to mind.

8.title: 8. Humanity, 2050
8.topContent: Think about the totality of human activities currently taking place on the planet. What future do you see for humanity in 2050? Try to create a colour that best represents what comes to mind.

9.title: 9. Age
9.topContent:
To answer this and the following questions, please drag the slider (small black circle) on the vertical axis to the position that corresponds to your answer.

How old are you?

10.title: 10. % Suburbs
10.topContent: How much of your life (approximately) have you spent in the suburbs?

11.title: 11. Nature
11.topContent: Think about the different aspects of your life: housing, transportation, work, food, material possessions, lifestyle, etc. Overall, how much of your life do you feel is in harmony with the natural environment?

12.title: 12. Genre
12.topContent: To what degree do you identify with the traditional idea of "being a man" or "being a woman"?
12.scaleLabelMax: I identify 100% with the traditional idea of "being a woman."
12.scaleLabelZero: I do not identify with a traditional gender binary
12.scaleLabelMin: I identify 100% with the traditional idea of "being a man"

13.title: 13. Status
13.scaleLabelMax: I and/or my family are rich and powerful
13.scaleLabelMin: I and/or my family are totally destitute

14.title: 14. Postal Code
14.bottomContent: I do not live in Canada

15.title: 15. Evaluation
15.topContent: Overall, how would you rate your responses to this questionnaire?
15.scaleLabelMax: I answered honestly and to the best of my ability
15.scaleLabelMin: I answered anything, it doesn't mean anything

submit.title: End
submit.textContent: If you would like to see the results of the project, please leave your email to receive a viewing link at the end of the exhibition. (Your email will not be shared.)
